Container.Name: Directus
Container.Overview: An Instant App & API for your SQL Database. Directus wraps your new or existing SQL database with a realtime GraphQL+REST API for developers, and an intuitive admin app for non-technical users.
Container.Description:
"An Instant App & API for your SQL Database. Directus wraps your new or existing SQL database with a realtime GraphQL+REST API for developers, and an intuitive admin app for non-technical users." (description from the application's author)
Most users will probably value the user-friendly and yet mighty front-end aspect to SQL databases.
Directus can be a headless CMS, your table viewer, UI/app builder for web apps and more to visualize and manage your SQL-stored data. It's a wrapper, doesn't mess with your data and doesn't lock you into a proprietary solution. Directus functions as interface and app, but the backend can be detached at any time. It lends itself very well to home users as well as advanced users and can handle file up- and downloads.
*******
Default admin credentials:
ADMIN_EMAIL="admin@example.com"
ADMIN_PASSWORD will be printed in the log shortly after first launch. If you missed it and cleared the log wipe your config and try again.
You can also (before the first launch) pass credentials through the template fields, however I'd advise to clear them afterwards and to never stay on the default password. Remember to follow good password hygiene rules. :)

Config.Name: Admin Email
Config.Description: The Direcuts Admin User Account. Feel free to change this to your email address.

Config.Name: Admin Password
Config.Description: The Direcuts Admin User Account. Feel free to pass your desired password here, otherwise a default password will be generated on first launch. (check logs!)

Config.Name: App Data/Uploads
Config.Description:
Container Path: /directus/uploads/
This is where your files get stored you upload to and manage within Directus

Config.Name: Database
Config.Description: What database client to use. One of pg or postgres, mysql, oracledb, mssql, or sqlite3.

Config.Name: Database Host
Config.Description: Database host. Required when using pg, mysql, oracledb, or mssql.

Config.Name: Database Port
Config.Description: Database port. Required when using pg, mysql, oracledb, or mssql.

Config.Name: Database Name
Config.Description: Database name. Required when using pg, mysql, oracledb, or mssql.

Config.Name: Database User
Config.Description: Database user. Required when using pg, mysql, oracledb, or mssql.

Config.Name: Database Password
Config.Description: Database user's password. Required when using pg, mysql, oracledb, or mssql.

Config.Name: Database Filename
Config.Description: Where to read/write the SQLite database. Required when using sqlite3.

Config.Name: Postgres Connection String
Config.Description: When using pg, you can submit a connection string instead of individual properties. Using this will ignore any of the other connection settings.
